description: M-6 Travaux de r\u00e9paration de la structure du b\u00e2timentVous \u00eates par la pr\u00e9sente invit\u00e9e \u00e0 soumettre une offre technique \u00e9lectronique et une offre Formulaire de proposition distincte, en deux (2) attachements, pour satisfaire au besoin dont fait \u00e9tat la pr\u00e9sente demande d\u2019offres \u00e0 commandes (DOC).
full_summary:
## Tender Announcement: Repair of Building M6's Structural Elements
The National Research Council Canada (NRC-CNRC) invites contractors to submit their proposals to repair the structural elements of Building M6.

### Reference and Tender Information
- **Title (English):** Repair of Building M6's Structural Elements
- **Title (French):** Réparation des éléments structurels de l'édifice M-6
- **Reference Number:** PW-22-01013953
- **Tender Number:** 22-58089
- **Publication Date:** November 18, 2022
- **Closing Date:** December 14, 2022

### Project Overview
NRC-CNRC requires a contractor to execute a project that includes:

* Concrete beam column and wall remediation in Building M6
* Project managers with relevant experience to handle the projects

### Evaluation Criteria and Requirements
A combination of technical and price rating will be used to evaluate the proposals. The technical assessment will account for 40% of the total score, while the price rating will account for the remaining 60%.

* Mandatory requirements for the contract include:
	1. The contractor must have a minimum of 10 years of experience in concrete repair projects
	2. The proposed Construction Site Supervisor must have a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience
	3. The proposed Project Manager must have a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience

* Evaluated technical criteria include:
	1. Bidder's experience and relevant history (up to 8 points)
	2. Qualifications and overall experience of proposed Construction Site Supervisor (up to 5 points)
	3. Qualifications and overall experience of proposed Project Manager (up to 5 points)
	4. Construction schedule and timelines (up to 7 points)

### Tendering Process
All proposals, including technical and financial information, should be submitted in two separate attachments.

* Technical proposals should clearly outline the bidder's experience, qualifications, and approach to the project.
* Financial proposals should be included in the Tender Form

## Security Clearance and Requirements
It is mandatory for bidders to meet the security requirements. The contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD).

Contact Information
* For any inquiries regarding the project, please contact Allan Mackenzie at [Allan.Mackenzie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Allan.Mackenzie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca).
* For security
